sense.name: physical harm, damage, a wound
sense.commentary: INJURY[+state][+physical][+damage][+bodily] Note: refers to harm of a living being, not an inanimate object
sense.examples: They escaped the car crash without injury. These medical units can treat injuries right on the battlefield. Mary got an injury to her back when she fell on the ice. The horse was treated for an injury to its hind leg. This law firm deals with personal injury in the workplace. (physical harm)

sense.name: the act of harming or hurting someone
sense.commentary: INJURY[+event][+act][+harmful] Note: X's injury of Y -> X injured Y (nominalization)
sense.examples: John's injury of her feelings by that remark was not intentional. The boxer's injury of his opponent ended the match.

sense.name: the violation of one's rights for which there is legal recourse
sense.examples: He is suing his former company for injuries related to patent infringements. This law can only partially make up for the injuries done to their rights as citizens.
